attributes.action: Iain Duncan Smith MP: Give sick cancer patients access to financial support
attributes.background: The benefit rules should be relaxed for cancer patients who prove they are genuinely sick, regardless of their age, employment status and financial status.
attributes.additional_details: Cancer comes with huge costs. Not just physically and emotionally, but also financially. It robs people of their ability to work, their livelihoods and their savings. While cancer is classed as a disability in some aspects of law, it isn't classed as a disability when applying for benefits. Under the current government, cancer patients are being denied access to crucial financial support. That support needs to be made more accessible - because cancer is devastating enough.

attributes.action: Make the wage rise, due to happen in april 16, apply to aged 21 and over
attributes.background: A person aged 21 and a person aged 25 still has to pay the same bills, the same rent and the same council tax. Although, in April 2016 NMW will rise only for over 25's to £7.20 per hour. I don't do any less work than a 25 year old but I am not entitled to a "living wage". Why?
attributes.additional_details: A person aged 25 can start work for the first time and receive £7.20 as NMW. Whereas I have worked my way up from about four pound an hour from age 16. I am now 22 and I see that I am still being discriminated against due to my age. What happened to equality, fairness and justice?

attributes.action: Local Authority SEN Departments MUST be made accountable to statutory timescale.
attributes.background: This petition is to make Local Authority Special Educational Needs departments, accountable when failing to meet statutory guidelines, and those determined by Sendist. Local Authority's are currently not accountable when failing to meet those timescales, and this MUST change.
attributes.additional_details:
Having faced two SEN tribunals to date, I'm faced with another battle. 
The Local Authority SEN department procedures for issuing EHC plans, are governed by statutory guidelines, and also guidelines determined by Sendist Tribunal. 

However, Local Authority's are not held accountable for either timescales and as in my case exceed them by an excessive amount of time with no accountability. Local Authority's MUST be made legally accountable for unjust and unfair delays to securing SEN support.

attributes.action: Ban the import, sale and production of all halal or kosher meat.
attributes.background: Animals should be slaughtered as quickly as possible and with the minimum of pain and suffering in meat production.  The slaughter to produce Halal and Kosher does not meet this standard.

attributes.action: Allow Hamde Abu Rahma, Palestinian photo journalist a visa to travel the UK.
attributes.background: Hamde Abu Rahma is a Palestinian photo journalist from Bil'in in the West Bank.  He has been refused for a second time a visa to come to the UK for the Edinburgh festival despite having financial backing.  He's been shot at, seen family killed and still remains peaceful.  He wants to tell his story.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of Paignton and Brixham hospitals, Devon.
attributes.background: Torbay is struggling to cope as it is and it will be the elderly patients that will suffer further.

attributes.action: To put an age limit on piercings.
attributes.background: It is time to put an age limit on piercings. Babies are frequently pierced at the request of their parents. In any other circumstance this would be considered GBH, and completely ignores the rights of the baby. The main issue being the legalities of such a trend, but also the dangers it presents.
attributes.additional_details: At any reputable piercing place, with any reputable piercer, they would point blank refuse to pierce a baby's ears. Which in itself speaks volumes. This has no benefit towards the baby at all, and is solely for the parents. Babies are small people, with rights. They are not accessories, and to force this on a baby would not be acceptable in any other circumstance.

attributes.action: Legalise the production, use and sale of cannabis in the uk.
attributes.background: The use, production and sale of cannabis would create jobs boost the economy and has been proven to treat diseases and lower pain it would also allow the prison system to focus on real crimes.

attributes.action: Call on Turkish government to end its military operations on the Kurdish people!
attributes.background: Turkey’s ruling Justice and Development Party (AKP) is undertaking deeply divisive military action in the predominantly Kurdish Eastern and Southeastern Anatolian provinces, which involves imposing curfews and blockades, attacking innocent Kurdish civilians with tanks & snipers, shooting civilians.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the curfews and military operations started hundreds of innocent civilians have lost their lives as a result. 56 curfews have been declared in at least 19 districts of 7 cities since July 2015. Resultantly, 600 civilians were killed. Curfews and military operations are still going on in the districts of Cizre, Sur and Silopi. 

So far, to the dismay and anger of pro-peace and pro-democracy forces in Turkey, Western governments have refused to condemn or highlight the breaches of human rights and brutality by the current government of Turkey.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory that all schools+colleges have atleast 1 full time counsellor
attributes.background: Mental health is an issue which just seems to be getting worse, the NHS is already under pressure and mental health isn't improving throughout the UK. All schools and colleges should have atleast one trained counsellor to help students and even staff, while taking the pressure of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I attend one college in Cornwall which has recently had all counsellors fired in order to meet appropriate budget cuts. The education system should care just as much about their pupils health as they do about their grades.

attributes.action: Lower the cervical cancer smear test age to 18
attributes.background: Over the years on the news and media the country has taken witness to many unfortunate undiagnosed cases of cervical cancer. Many girls considered 'underage' losing their lives to cervical cancer because they are deemed a lesser risk... Previous events say otherwise
attributes.additional_details: So many young women and girls have unfortunately lost their lives to this silent killer all because cases of cervical cancer are considered less likely in women under 25 and are more likely to test and that only 65 out 3000 cases diagnosed are under 25 but they are still cases none the less. Surely the unfortunate deaths of previous young women considered 'underage' have not died in vain. Women's rights have come along way but why isn't this a given right for young women everywhere?

attributes.action: Take into account the faith of Pakistani Christians when they claim asylum.
attributes.background: When considering Asylum applications from Pakistani Christians the Immigation Service should recognise that Pakistan is a dangerous place for Christians. To tell them simply to be Christian in secret is to misunderstand the Biblical command to gently and respectfully speak about Jesus Christ.
attributes.additional_details: This year's Easter Sunday bombing, targeted at Christians, is tragically just the latest in a long line of lynchings, church-bombings and house-burnings. In practice there is little or no protection of religious minorities by the authorities; perpetrators know they are more likely to be praised than prosecuted. See the list of atrocities on the Wikipedia page "Christianity in Pakistan". Search for Pakistan in the web pages of Barnabas Fund or Christian Solidarity Worldwide.

attributes.action: To ask Government for additional funding to postpone closure of UTC Lancashire
attributes.background: Parents and learners were told on the 03/05/2016 that UTC Lancashire would be closing on the 31/08/16. This will majorly impact on current learners from completing their GCSEs and A-levels in the summer of 2017. Please provide additional funding to postpone closure and to allow completion of exams.
attributes.additional_details: UTC Lancashire opened in Aug 2013-My son is flourishing in his subjects, he's hitting distinctions,despite never being a distinction pupil. He loves this learning environment and to have this taken away now half way through his GCSEs is so unfair.  The level of apprenticeship quality that is coming out of UTC is second to none. Learners are taught the skills, work ethic & given work experience to find employment.  The syllabus is so specialised no other secondary school can take on these pupils.

attributes.action: Build more social housing instead of the HS2 railway
attributes.background: The plan to upgrade the railway link from London to Birmingham is very costly, will take many years to build and will have a negative impact on the environment and many people's lives. Far better to spend the money allocated for this on social housing.
attributes.additional_details:
The estimated cost of HS2 is over £50 BILLION - it could be more than this of course: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201415/ldselect/ldeconaf/134/13406.htm
The benefits of reducing the travelling time by train between Birmingham and London are arguable, but look a lot less beneficial when the cost is so great.
20 years from now when HS2 is expected to be completed, it's possible that new IT infrastructure and working practices might reduce the need for business and social travel.

attributes.action: Call on the UK Government to urge the EU to increase tariffs on subsidised steel
attributes.background: The dumping of subsidised Chinese steel threatens the existence of the UK steel industry with, potentially, thousands becoming unemployed. This is not just a problem in the UK; cheap imports threaten steel making in the wider EU. We should call on the EU to impose higher tariffs on such imports.
attributes.additional_details: Due to State subsidies & overproduction, the Chinese steel industry has undercut EU steel by selling at prices which are lower than the production costs. This process has had the effect of depressing the whole market & jeopardising the future of steel making in the EU, including in the UK. Tata Steel, for example, has decided to sell all its UK plants citing cheap imports as a contributing factor. Any future steel production in the UK would face the same issue unless our government acts swiftly.

attributes.action: To make the A52, A15, A16, A17 in to dual carriage ways
attributes.background: The road systems in Lincolnshire have long been neglected resulting in unsafe potholes, faded road markings and an increase in road traffic collisions over the years. Due to the growth in population and industry the road in Lincolnshire simply cannot cope.
attributes.additional_details: By converting the four major roads throughout Lincolnshire into dual carrigeways this may potentially reduce traffic congestion within the main towns, decrease the risk of road incidents and encourage safer trade within the county. Within a year the A15 alone has seen an increase in road traffic fatalities due to an increase of vehicles on the roads - a dual carriageway on this particular road may make life easier for thriving agricultural and industrial businesses but it could also save lives.

attributes.action: Ensure Knowsley students have the opportunity to take A-Levels
attributes.background: No school in the entire borough of Knowsley offers A-Levels, which are often required for top universities or courses such as Medicine, limiting opportunities for children in Knowsley. Most schools in the borough are academies, so change requires direct intervention by the Department of Education.
attributes.additional_details: The last school to offer A Levels in Knowsley, Halewood Academy, announced in April that they would not be offering A-Levels in the coming year. Knowsley is one of the most deprived boroughs in the country, and many families cannot afford to send children out of the borough to schools or sixth forms that offer A-Levels. This effectively bars children from going to top universities and studying certain subjects which require A-Levels, harming social mobility and hampering the dreams of many.

attributes.action: Assess both parents income when working out child maintenance
attributes.background: The new child maintenance service should take the receiving parents finances into consideration, to not put the paying parents family in poverty. The system at presents potentially can take from one child to give to another. Finances from both families should be assessed to make a fairer system.
attributes.additional_details:
The child maintenance does not take into consideration out going payments such as Rent and other financial obligations potentially putting a paying parents family at risk of being evicted. 
Maintenance should be based on individual cases. Currently the service does not take into account that the receiving parent could be with a high earner potentially putting another family in poverty. It also does not take into account an older child whom maintenance is being paid for is in part time work.

attributes.action: Request the government to press the Bangladeshi government to free Shafik Rehman
attributes.background:
Shafik Rehman, 81 has been arrested for conspiring to kill the son of the Bangladesh Prime Minister. This government have arrested several journalists on trumped up charges but never as serious or as incredible as this one. 

He is being held on remand for interrogation by the Secret Service.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Rehman, a British citizen,  has been a proponent of democracy throughout his life and to that end has written strongly against past dictators and this current government who were elected unopposed when the main opposition refused to stand in the previous election.

He is the person who introduced Valentines Day to Bangladesh, wrote a book against Capital Punishment and his investigative journalism has changed the course of Bangladesh's history.

He is a man of peace with a powerful pen.

attributes.action: Improve services for youth mental health
attributes.background: I'm the founder of a campaign called 'The Mental Youth'. We exist because support and services for young people with mental health problems is simply not good enough. We want there to be support for anyone who needs it, regardless of their age.
attributes.additional_details: Most people with mental health conditions find their symptoms first manifesting before they are 16. Why do we receive such a small portion of the budget for national mental health? We don't get talked about because we haven't had a voice. Help us get heard.

attributes.action: Provide group b streptococcus leaflets with all pregnancy packs
attributes.background: Group b streptococcus  (GBS) is a normal bacterium which colonises between 20-30% of women lethel to a newborn baby when in labour if not detected and passed on from mother to a baby with a average of 80 deaths a year and long term disabilitys most though no awareness
attributes.additional_details: UK currently don't routine test for gbs and no information is giving out from health care teams I believe by putting 1 leaflet in every pregnancy pack it will definitely be read by the mother giving her a choice to test for infection privately to protect her baby awareness of this infection is extremely important

attributes.action: Stop the removal of NHS bursaries for student radiographers and nurses
attributes.background: An NHS bursary is currently available for students studying Radiography and Nursing. This is essential financial support as these courses involve both clinical and academic components. The Government is proposing to remove these bursaries and replace them with student loans.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS bursary supports the student to undertake clinical placements as part of their training. These can be up to 16 weeks in duration and in rural areas the distance between the campus and hospital is uncommutable, requiring the student to pay rent on their main accommodation plus rent, living and travel expenses in their clinical setting. This is financially disadvantageous to students in rural areas like Cumbria, Devon and Northumberland and will have a negative impact on the profession.

attributes.action: Introduce the Varicella Zoster (Chickenpox) into the UK Childhood Immunisations.
attributes.background: Chickenpox is pretty much unheard of in the USA, Japan and Germany. A vaccination was approved in 1995 and has been used for 20 years. It  was combined with the MMR vaccine creating an MMRV vaccine in 2005. The World Health Organisation includes it as one of children's vital immunisations.
attributes.additional_details:
Chickenpox complications include severe skin infections, scars, brain damage and death. There is no reason children should suffer these complications when there is a safe vaccine already available. 
Studies have confirmed that the cost to the NHS would be offset by not having to deal with chickenpox complications, antibiotics prescribed, hospital, GP appointments aswell as time taken off work by parents caring for children infected with Chickenpox.

attributes.action: Make ZANU a banned political organisation in the UK & Crown territories
attributes.background: Zanu actively intimidates Zimbabwean citizens abroad by indirect means as witnessed with the Nyatsuro forced farm aquisition as reported in UK papers recently.
attributes.additional_details: Zanu has maintained the ruling party power in Zimbabwe since 1980 and created a baseless law to forcibly aquire land and property for the government. Many hundreds of thousands were fired out their homes into poverty and foreign lands. Current estimates are that over 40% of Zimbabweans live abroad. Zanu continues to intimidate, terrorise and murder families of those abroad operating with impunity in UK and Crown territories. It's time to ban them like ISIS and other hate crime supporters.

attributes.action: Five steps to strengthen multi-agency responses to 'honour'-based violence (HBV)
attributes.additional_details:
Please see these links for more details:

IKWRO press release: http://ikwro.org.uk/2016/01/iranian-kurdish-womens-rights-organisation-and-filmmaker-join-forces-to-launch-campaign-in-remembrance-of-banaz-mahmod-on-10th-anniversary-of-her-murder/

HMIC Report: https://www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk/hmic/publications/the-depths-of-dishonour/

attributes.action: EU nationals to apply for British Citizenship for free
attributes.background: Future Brexit negotiations, might restrict the rights of EU nationals to continue living and working in the UK. By allowing free citizenship applications UK Government can put this right, avoiding discrimination against those with low income. Applications should be accepted until 23 June 2022.
attributes.additional_details: By facilitating EU nationals to acquire British citizenship, UK Government has the opportunity to counteract the inability of EU nationals living and working in the UK to vote at the latest Referendum. Additionally, UK Government, by allowing free citizenship applications from EU nationals, will also send a strong message to those who wants to divide our society that UK is a truly tolerant country which values those who contribute to its prosperity.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies here in the UK
attributes.background: Around 50 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's one a week. As it is illegal to abandon a baby in the UK, desperate women will often leave them in areas that are cold and unsafe, that is why the UK needs a law like the Safe Haven law that is active in all 50 States in America.
attributes.additional_details:
The Safe Haven law typically allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered at a fire station, hospital or other designated place with no names taken and no questions asked. This ensures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions. 

Whilst this is a highly emotive issue and some will argue that it encourages irresponsibility, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most vulnerable.

attributes.action: Ban the Saudi Royal Family from the UK for human rights abuses.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have just executed 47 people including Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr which has inflamed tensions in the Middle East. Saudi Arabia also execute gay people and treat women as second class citizens. The way they treat their own citizens is abhorrent, it is not a justice system, it is barbaric.
attributes.additional_details: Our Government should condemn them outright and make it clear they are not welcome in the UK. We want to ban Donald Trump for his hateful views, arguably Saudi Arabia are far worse for their archaic laws, executing gay people, atheist and women can never be justified and as a country that is supposed to stand for human rights we should stand firm.

attributes.action: Increase university loans for art based courses.
attributes.background: Studying at university is an incredibly expensive thing to choose to do, however the added cost of buying materials and printing work for those on art-based courses means that, without extra help from family and carers, it's virtually impossible.
attributes.additional_details:
I spend hundreds of pounds a year to ensure my work is up to standard. This is not what university is about.
Your grade should not be based on how much you are able to spend on modelling materials and printing, but your actual skills.
I would like to see the student loan company take the cost of a course into account when deciding loan amounts.

attributes.action: Recognition of Chronic Pancreatitis as a disability.
attributes.background:
Chronic Pancreatitis (CP) is a condition where the pancreas becomes permanently damaged from inflammation.

The most common symptom of Pancreatitis is repeated episodes of abdominal pain, which can be severe, Chronic Pancreatitis is a highly debilitating condition with many other complications.
attributes.additional_details:
I am issuing this petition in the hope we can change the view people have of Pancreatitis, and allow those who have a diagnosis the chance to apply for a Blue Badge.

The DWP need to be more consistent with their decision making, It's a fact that some sufferers recieve DLA/ PIP whilst others have theirs refused. It is unethical to award some and not others. Whilst we acknowledge sufferers may have differing severities and other conditions, this is not always the case when the decision is made.

attributes.action: David Cameron TO ASK Bangladesh Government about killing Opposition Politicians
attributes.background:
The British Government gives Hundreds of Millions of Pounds in Foreign Aid to the Present Bangladeshi Government every year. 
David Cameron must use this leverage to IMMEDIATELY DEMAND that Mr Motiur Rahman Nizami, a veteran Opposition Politician and the former Industries Minister, is not killed.

attributes.action: Working Men to have full pay during their two weeks of paternity leave.
attributes.background: I am about to have my first child, and after looking into my allowances for paternity leave it saddens me to discover i am only entitled to two taxable payments of £140. I believe working men should receive full pay for two weeks of paternity leave, so they can bond with their child with outstress.
attributes.additional_details: The first two weeks of childs life are some of the most important when it comes to creating a bond. To be able to do this without the stresses of money is every fathers right. The current allowance for paternity leave is simply not feasible and a better solution must be found so all fathers can enjoy the early days of his childs life.

attributes.action: Apologise to all ex HM Forces personnel dismissed for being gay.
attributes.background: HM Forces men and women were investigated and discharged from the Armed forces, simply for being gay. They suffered emotional, mental and material scars that still last today - homelessness, loss of friends, job and pension, rejection by family, and still no alternative career. We want an apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Apparently in 2007, an apology was issued by the MOD: http://www.theguardian.com/uk/2007/jun/28/gayrights.military. This doesn't count as an apology to those individuals. My original letter to the Guardian, 7 years ago is here: Original letter to The Guardian 7 years ago: http://gu.com/p/22k28/sbl
The Queen and the Government have so far refused to get involved. The matter was taken up in Parliament in 2015 by Paul Blomfield, MP for Sheffield Central.

attributes.action: Review the KS2 writing assessment criteria regarding spelling (before 30.06.16)
attributes.background: This year Y6 pupils have to meet criteria to reach the government's expected standard. All of it has to be met, as well as spelling, regardless of specific learning difficulties, including dyslexia. No matter how creative children are, they will not achieve the expected standard for their age.
attributes.additional_details:
We, as Y6 teachers, feel this will impact negatively on children's motivation to write and their self-esteem. This petition has been set up on behalf of such children who have worked hard all year, as well as parents who may not understand the consequences of this aspect of the education policy.
The government may say that children are allowed to use dictionaries, although this can stunt creativity and would not help children with spelling difficulties like dyslexia.

attributes.action: Provide an online instant-messaging alternative to phone and post with the DWP.
attributes.background:
If you can't use the phone due to hearing issues, anxiety, or processing speed, your only alternative with the DWP is postal communication. Most of us who need to do that have had their paperwork get lost.

Give us a way to communicate with the DWP in real time and save our conversation easily.
attributes.additional_details:
If you can't use the phone but have a support worker, you still need to give consent over the phone when your support worker calls them. Then there is no record of the call or what happened.

The only alternative is post, which is slow and prone to lost paperwork, requires a trip to the post office to pay for signed-for delivery for even minor communication.

Setting up a textphone system is complicated and sometimes expensive. Not everyone is able, especially if they don't have benefits yet.

attributes.action: British Parliment should not have a summer recess this year.
attributes.background: They should stay and work through the issues raised by BREXIT. This important to keep our economy stable throughout theses political changes .  Individuals should be able to take time off for family holidays, but for limited periods.

attributes.action: Protect UK Environment & Wildlife - adopt European environmental legislation.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU could leave our wildlife at risk. The EU has developed a strong set of laws that protect the environment and our wildlife. As these laws will not apply when the UK leaves the EU we need new laws for the UK that give our precious wildlife and environment the same protection.
attributes.additional_details:
Wildlife didn't get much of a mention in the referendum debate, that's a shame as it was something that Europe treasures and its laws were very good for protecting the environment. Without new laws protected sites and our countryside might not be protected unless we have new laws that make sure we take care of it. Many species of plants, animals & invertebrates are declining, the UK Government should make it a priority to do what we can to stop this.

http://www.wildlifetrusts.org/EU-Ref/reports

attributes.action: Stop the new INFRASTRUCTURE BILL.
attributes.background: This new bill will effectively privatize the Land Registry department. It means public land and asserts will now be In control of a private profit making company. This allow Fracking companies to set up in woodland, or parks, without public or council opposition.
attributes.additional_details: The government’s new Infrastructure Bill removes control for decisions to sell or develop publicly owned land from the public sector. In short, a private company will have the power to sell publicly owned land for Fracking, or whatever.The Infrastructure Bill has somehow managed to slip through to its Second Reading in the House of Lords from 1830 Wednesday 18th June 2014. The Bill contains a clause that will end local decision making over use of publicly owned land by councils or the public.

attributes.action: Let members of the public be present and ask questions at PMQ'S
attributes.background: The government claims to be democratic and to represent the people, yet when do the public get to talk or ask questions to the people who are supposedly representing us? MP's frequently forget that there is a world outside of Parliaments walls. It's time the people held the government to account.

attributes.action: Launch independent UK inquiry into the Panama Papers
attributes.background: Recently leaked documents named the "Panama Papers" suggest  that people across the globe have avoided paying tax.
attributes.additional_details: Recently leaked documents named the "Panama Papers" suggest  that people across the globe have avoided paying tax.

attributes.action: Franchise to commit c2c to fast train services with stops at Southend stations
attributes.background: Timetable changes which came into force in December 2015 have led to massive overcrowding and delays to commuter journeys from Southend stations.
attributes.additional_details: Trains make more stops at London stations which means that evening commuters face travelling on dangerously packed trains. Changes to the morning timetable mean fewer trains stopping at Southend stations causing disruption and overcrowding on morning commutes. The Department for Transport must require c2c to listen to their customers and return to the original timetable. We call for the reintroduction of the old timetable which included fast services and stops at Southend stations.

attributes.action: Change the law, to set minimum prison sentences for those who abuse animals
attributes.background: The government should change the laws to set minimal prison sentences and life long bans for people convicted of animal abuse. These poor excuses of humans should be punished for their crimes rather than a 5 year ban for owning animals. Animals don't have a voice. Please be their voice and help them

attributes.action: Use NO public money on a Garden Bridge folly for London, use for social housing
attributes.background: The government intends to spend £30M on a Garden Bridge folly for London. This would be better spend on helping the homeless or shoring up flood defences in worst hit areas. This will be a private bridge with no public right of way, run by a private company.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2016/jan/16/garden-bridge-george-osborne-avoided-official-channels-mayor

attributes.action: Condemn the Macedonian authoritarian regime that pardons organised crime.
attributes.background: Macedonia, FYR, a EU candidate country is in a political crisis caused by a corrupt authoritarian rule that has mostly been given support by the governments of the EU member states. The crisis escalated last year when the wrongdoing were revealed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 12.04.16 the president granted blanket pardon of politicians under investigation, people in Macedonia rebelled.. Police responded by beating up and arresting protesters and journalists.

The BBC has reported on the latest incidents:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36041381

More details about the wrongdoings: the  'Priebe report' by the European commission available on
http://ec.europa.eu/enlargement/news_corner/news/news-files/20150619_recommendations_of_the_senior_experts_group.pdf

attributes.action: Impose Nationwide moratorium on basement applications and change planning rules
attributes.background: The threat to neighbourhoods and businesses suffering this plague of development show planning rules to be far too heavily weighted in favour of developers.  Local residents and businesses, ambushed by ambitions plans, are now often locked out of any consultation process - their rights ignored.
attributes.additional_details: Local councils, who they count on to represent their interests are increasingly unwilling to fund legal appeals against their own refusals of planning consent - so give in.   Now, not only are homes and businesses put at risk but the quality of life of entire neighbourhoods is vandalised.  Innocent property owners should not have to mortgage their livelihoods to fight off the life-style expansions imposed by their neighbours and absent developers.  This is wrong and needs to change nationally.

attributes.action: Set one day a year as Forces recognition and Covenant Day.
attributes.background: We Veterans and supporting civilians feel that a special day. would increase the understanding  between   active service persons, cadets, veterans, and the civilian population of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
The day could be used country wide for
1    Public relations activities.
2    Military meet the people events.
3    Veterans  in the schools.
4    Covenant Representatives inform the public about their activities.
5    Corps, and Regimental associations inform about their activities in helping serving, and veteran service persons.

And many more such activities, informing the general public  about the quality of our Armed Forces, its Veterans, the Cadet Forces, and the supporting civilian workers. Which we know is second too none.

attributes.action: Save the Environment Land Based Science (ELBS) GCSE from ending in 2018.
attributes.background: Please do not let this generation suffer and the rural sector miss out from this damaging decision. ELBS is a fantastic course for secondary education to offer especially in rural areas, developing the next generation and inspiring teenagers to live and work in the rural community or animal care.
attributes.additional_details: Our school in Kingsteignton Devon has had a farm since 2009 offering this land based science course. Many of our students at Teign School live in the rural community this has been a huge asset in education. As well as offering students GCSEs Rydon Primary school also visit for educating younger children reaching out to over 1600 students. Our farm will now have to close due to this decision, it will have devastating impact throughout education and the local communities. Together we're stronger.

attributes.action: Give Ministers for 'Out' in the referendum equal access to the Civil Service.
attributes.background: Number 10 has announced that unequal treatment for Ministers on either side of the referendum campaign. This is manifestly unfair and undemocratic. All Ministers should receive equal treatment.

attributes.action: Vacuum Erection Devices should remain as a high priority treatment for ED
attributes.background: An increasing number of CCG's are restricting the availability of Vacuum Erection Devices as a treatment for erectile dysfunction on community FP10 prescription by listing it as a "low priority" treatment against the grain of clinical evidence and recommendation by Urological Consultant Specialists
attributes.additional_details: Numerous published studies exist supporting the use of VED's as a safe, effective and high compliance treatment for erectile dysfunction of all aetiologies and as a penile rehabilitation tool post pelvic cancer treatment eg prostatectomy. Supported also by organisations such as the British Society of Sexual Medicine, MacMillan and Prostate Cancer UK, and sexual health specialists across the UK. Low cost option with up to a 5 year warranty with no effective restriction on frequency of use.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Poland syndrome and provide more info to those affected.
attributes.background: With our personal experience when we found out our son had Poland syndrome we found it really hard to get any information on this and also very few doctors have even heard of Poland syndrome. We feel after to speaking to others in the same position that there should be more info for us.
attributes.additional_details: Poland syndrome is a rare birth defect characterized by underdevelopment or absence of the chest pectoralis muscle and webbing of the fingers. In most individuals the missing part is the large Pectoralis muscle that attaches to the upper arm on one side and the breastbone. Abnormalities may affect muscles in the chest wall, side and shoulder and also rib cage abnormalities, Breast and nipple abnormalities may occur, may also affect internal organs.
